714219f-a.title: Manhattan: 68th Street - York Avenue
714219f-a.text:
(1)
68th Street, west of adjoining, and at the N.W. corner of York
Ave. The large buildings in the background are the Cornell
University-New York Hospital buildings.
March 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same and showing also York Ave., at and adjoining the N.W.
corner of East 68th Street.
September 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 1, and showing a further view in both directions.
March 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724892f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724892f-a.text:
York Avenue (Avenue A), west side, from o8th to 69th Streets. The
third building from the corner, on b8th Street, goes through the
block to b9th Street; it used to be a stable belonging to Thomas
Crimmins, Contractor.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRNODUCCCIONS.

724895f-b.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724895f-b.text:
Construction of New York Hospital -- Cornell Medical College,
York Avenue, east side, from dBth to 71st Streets, showing S.E.
corner of o8th Street.
This particular view is nearly straight north on York Avenue,
from the roofs on the west side at 6oth Street.
July 31, 1V30.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
New York Hospital -- Cornell Medical College, construction
nearly completed, York Avenue, east side, from 68th to 71st
Streets, showing S.E. corner of o8th Street. Eleven months
have passed since the preceding view was taken.
The playground of the Lenox Hill Neighborhood Association, shown
on the right foregrouno of the preceding view, has now given
place to tennis courts.
June 30, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

714221f-b.title: Manhattan: 68th Street - York Avenue
714221f-b.text:
(1)
68th Street, from but not including York, to but not including  Marie Curie Aves.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same view at a later date and showing the New York Hospital
and Cornell Medical University occupying the former site of the
Central Brewing Plant. In the foreground appears York Ave.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 1, as seen from the N.W. corner of East 67th Street
at York Ave. Note children's play house No.'37 Eaat 67th Street''
in the foreground.
September 13, 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724890f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724890f-a.text:
York Ave., east side, at East 68th Street, showing north of that
point the new buildings comprising the New York Hospital and Cornell
Medical College.
1935.
George Jirnek.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

724896f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724896f-a.text:
York Avenue, east side, from East 68th to 71st
Streets, showing a night view of the New York Hospital
and Cornell Medica) College buildings. This photo is
hnohtheastward from a rooftop at 430 East 67th Street
and shows in the foreground a portion of the recently
completed Memorial Hgspital for the Treatment of Cancer.
Fall, 1939
Gif of George Jiranek
Photostat Division
New York Public Library
MAY BE RC RODUCED

714223f-a.title: Manhattan: 68th Street (West) - York Avenue.
714223f-a.text:
68th Street, west of, adjoiing, and at the
north-west corner of fork Avenue. Ihe large
buildings in the background are the Cornell
University-New lork Hospital buildings.
March 5, 1933
P. L. Sperr, photographer

724893f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724893f-a.text:
Construction of New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College, York
Avenue, east side, from o8th to 70th Streets, seen from 67th Street
between First and York Avenues.
July 31, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724889f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street (East)
724889f-a.text:
York Avenue (formerly Avenue ''A''), at the S.W.
corner of East 68th Street, showing the easterly and
northerly sides of the recently constructed Memorial Hospital
for the Treatment of Cancer and Allied Diseases.
At the right the photographer shows a westward view
on the south side of East o8th Street, towards First Avenue
where St. Catherines Park and the Julia Richmond High School
appear.
November 13, 1939
0ift of George Jiranek
New York Public Lirary
Photostat Division
MAY BE REPRODUCED

1558173.title: York Avenue - East 68th Street
1558173.folder: York Avenue - East 68th Street, Manhattan, NY

1558174.title: York Avenue - East 68th Street
1558174.folder: York Avenue - East 68th Street, Manhattan, NY

1558176.title: York Avenue - East 68th Street

724891f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724891f-a.text:
york Avenue (Avenue A), east side, north from o8th Street. The
building on the N.E. corner of 6Bth Street is only slightly in
the picture; it is the old ''Century'' apartment house.
68th to b9th Streets is the old site of Jones Woods Coliseum (to about
1895, known in 1891 as Empire City Coliseum). 1294-1304 Avenue A,
from 69th to 70th Streets, were built after 1902. That block used
to be Washington Park. From 70th to 71st Streets may be seen the
old cigar factories. The white building, from 71st to 72nd Streets,
is Ehe new plant of P. Lorillard Company, built since 1920 on the
site of the old Clausen malt house. Everything from o8th to 71st
Streets is about to be demolished.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724894f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724894f-a.text:
New York Hospital and Cornell Mecical College, nearing completion,
York Avenue, east side, from 6Bth to 71st Streets, showing also
e8th Street at west side of York Avenue.
On the S.W. corner of 68th Street, adjoining the tennis courts, the
old Seidenberg factory has recently been demolished.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

724888f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 68th Street
724888f-a.text:
(1)
York Avenue (Avenue A) at N.E. corner of oBth Street, showing
''The Central'', an apartment house built in 1902, and about
to be demolished.
Prior to about 1895 this block was occupied by Jones Woods
Coliseum, known in its last few years as Empire City Coliseum.
The name York Avenue was officially adopted late in 1928.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
York Avenue at N.E. corner of o8th Street, seen from the south-
west and showing the other corners.
The new New York Hospital and Co nell Medical College buildinga,
nearing completion, occupy the land east of York Avenue from
68th to 70th Streets.
On the S.W. corner, adjoining the tennis courts in the foreground,
the Seidenberg factory has been demolished.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

The name York Avenue was officially adopted late in 1928.

(2)
